node.title: Diplomats Warn Russia of ‘Massive Consequences’ if It Invades Ukraine
node.alt: Liz Truss, center, Britain’s foreign secretary, next to Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken on Sunday in Liverpool, England.
node.description: The foreign ministers for the Group of 7 urged Russia to pull back from the tense border standoff. It has massed as many as 100,000 troops on Ukraine’s eastern, northern and southern frontiers.
node.content: ["LIVERPOOL, England \u2014 The top diplomats for the world\u2019s wealthiest large democracies warned Russia on Sunday of \u201cmassive consequences\u201d and \u201csevere costs\u201d should it invade Ukraine or continue military aggressions near its border.", "The foreign ministers for the Group of 7 urged Russia to pull back from the tense border standoff and made clear that any effort to negotiate or otherwise avoid confrontation would be welcome.", "\u201cAny use of force to change borders is strictly prohibited under international law,\u201d they said in a statement. \u201cRussia should be in no doubt that further military aggression against Ukraine would have massive consequences and severe cost in response.\u201d", "Their statement largely echoed earlier admonishments by Western officials over the past week after Russia massed as many as 100,000 troops on Ukraine\u2019s eastern, northern and southern borders. On Tuesday, in a two-hour video call, President Biden himself warned President Vladimir V. Putin of unprecedented and painful economic and other sanctions should Russia move in force into Ukraine and called for de-escalation and diplomacy.", "But he has promised Mr. Putin some sort of diplomatic discussion of European security, which has already disturbed some American allies.", "Mr. Putin has laid out a set of Russian goals that seem impossible to meet, including a written NATO guarantee withdrawing a 2008 NATO pledge to take Ukraine and Georgia into the alliance at some point in the future (a demand already rejected by Washington), and a promise not to deploy weaponry to countries bordering Russia or hold military drills within a certain distance from Russia.", "Sunday\u2019s warning also included Japan among the countries now condemning Russia\u2019s military buildup, and it was issued separate from the ministers\u2019 summary of a host of issues discussed \u2014 including complicated relations with China and Iran and the ramping up of distribution of the coronavirus vaccine \u2014 after two days of meetings in Liverpool, in northern England.", "\u201cWhat we have shown this weekend is that the world\u2019s largest economies are united,\u201d the British foreign secretary, Liz Truss, told reporters in Liverpool. \u201cWe have sent a powerful signal to our adversaries and our allies. We have been clear that any incursion by Russia into Ukraine would have massive consequences for which there would be a severe cost.\u201d", "The Group of 7 \u2014 Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan and the United States \u2014 account for about half of the global economy. Diplomats representing the European Union also attended the talks.", "Officials have said that Russia\u2019s military could be prepared to invade Ukraine as soon as January or February, although there is no indication that Mr. Putin has made up his mind whether to do so.", "Intelligence disclosed by the United States indicated that Russia\u2019s military had developed a war plan that envisioned as many as 175,000 troops pouring across Ukraine\u2019s border \u2014 a force that Ukraine\u2019s military, despite U.S.-provided equipment and training, would have little ability to stop.", "Mr. Putin has dismissed concerns about the troop buildup on Ukraine\u2019s border, and instead has said the United States and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization are threatening Russia\u2019s security by supporting Ukraine\u2019s military with arms and training.", "On Sunday, Mr. Putin\u2019s spokesman, Dmitri S. Peskov, said the Kremlin was prepared to continue what he described as an already substantive conversation about \u201cthe confrontational situation that has now emerged in Europe around Ukraine,\u201d according to the Russian news agency Interfax.", "Mr. Peskov also said reports about Russian troops on Ukraine\u2019s border were \u201cwhipping up information tension.\u201d", "\u201cThis is precisely done with the aim of further demonizing Russia,\u201d he said in an interview on Sunday, according to the state news agency Tass.", "The statement issued by the Group of 7 ministers did not specify what penalties Russia would face should it invade. The White House has warned that it is prepared to take steps against Russia, also unspecified, that the United States resisted in 2014, after Mr. Putin\u2019s government annexed the Crimean Peninsula in Ukraine. It could also lead NATO to reposition its troops in Europe.", "A senior State Department official who attended the talks in Liverpool said the joint statement showed that the Group of 7 and the European Union were \u201cabsolutely united\u201d in imposing tough penalties against Russia if necessary. It was a noteworthy description, given debate over cutting off Russia from the global financial settlement system, known as SWIFT, that some European officials have feared might provoke too harsh a response.", "\u201cWe reaffirm our unwavering commitment to Ukraine\u2019s sovereignty and territorial integrity,\u201d the statement said, adding that the signatories would \u201cintensify our cooperation on our common and comprehensive response.\u201d", "The senior State Department official described the summit as \u201ca very intense round of meetings\u201d that also highlighted concerns about commandos working for the Wagner Group, a Kremlin-linked private mercenary force, in Libya and elsewhere in Africa. The official accused the private force \u2014 which has also deployed to conflict zones in Belarus and across the Middle East to further Russia\u2019s interests \u2014 of \u201ccausing extreme problems\u201d in the Sahel, but did not elaborate.", "The official briefed reporters traveling with Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken on the condition anonymity to more openly discuss the diplomatic talks in Liverpool.", "The State Department is dispatching a senior official this week to Kyiv, the Ukrainian capital, and Moscow for talks to try to ease tensions. But the trip, by Karen Donfried, the assistant secretary of state who oversees American policy in Europe, will also \u201creinforce the United States\u2019 commitment to Ukraine\u2019s sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity,\u201d the department said in a statement.", "Diplomats in Liverpool also discussed ways to counter what was described as China\u2019s human rights abuses and predatory economic partnerships with developing countries, as well as how to speed humanitarian aid to Afghanistan, which is facing vast food shortages, while holding the Taliban to account.", "Additionally, Ms. Truss, the British foreign secretary, repeated her warning that the latest rounds of nuclear talks between world powers and Iran represented Tehran\u2019s \u201clast chance to come to the negotiating table with a serious resolution.\u201d Diplomats are trying to revive the 2015 accord \u2014 from which the Trump administration withdrew the United States in 2018 \u2014 that limited Iran\u2019s nuclear program in exchange for easing American financial sanctions.", "But eight months of negotiations after Mr. Biden took office, and signaled his intent to rejoin the deal, were dealt a severe, and perhaps fatal, setback by new leaders in Iran who are demanding that the sanctions be lifted before agreeing to other conditions.", "The talks, in their seventh round, continued on Sunday in Vienna. They recently resumed after a break of more than five months as Iran elected a new harder-line government.", "Germany\u2019s new foreign minister, Annalena Baerbock, said in Liverpool that \u201ctime is running out\u201d for a deal. Iran has moved to reject compromises reached in earlier rounds, she said. The latest round, she told reporters, \u201chas shown in the last days that we do not have any progress.\u201d", "China and Russia have indicated more patience with Iran, saying that the talks are proceeding, if slowly.", "\u201cThere is still time for Iran to come and agree this deal,\u201d Ms. Truss said.", "The senior State Department official said the discussions in Liverpool included options for action against Iran should the nuclear talks fall apart."]
